timeline.bodyText:
A comment unrelated to this file.

Just a few nit picks on the OTP registration form:

The "Device Name" input field looks different from the input field above. Isn't it perhaps missing some CSS class?
When the content is too long and needs to be scrolled, the background is acting somewhat weird. But this issue was present even before so maybe it's out of scope of this PR.
timeline.author: vmuzikar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,10 +1,10 @@
 <#import "template.ftl" as layout>

replies.bodyText: Yes, you're right. The input box is different, and I didn't even notice that. The background overflow is common issue in KC. For the future, it needs some polishing.Thanks @vmuzikar !
replies.author: mabartos

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure this is intentional but there's a grey rectangle always present in the footer of the login dialog. If registration is enabled, the registration link is present there. But when disabled, it's just empty. Not sure if this is intended?
timeline.author: vmuzikar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-<#macro registrationLayout bodyClass="" displayInfo=false displayMessage=true displayRequiredFields=false displayWide=false showAnotherWayIfPresent=true>
+<#macro registrationLayout bodyClass="" displayInfo=false displayMessage=true displayRequiredFields=false showAnotherWayIfPresent=true>
 <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN"  "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">

replies.bodyText: It's not intended. It needs some predicate, which helps to avoid the empty info message. Thanks!
replies.author: mabartos

timeline.bodyText: The page is completely broken in IE. We're starting to drop IE support, but not sure if we're ready to do so on something as elementary as the login screen. @pdrozd @stianst?
timeline.author: vmuzikar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-<#macro registrationLayout bodyClass="" displayInfo=false displayMessage=true displayRequiredFields=false displayWide=false showAnotherWayIfPresent=true>
+<#macro registrationLayout bodyClass="" displayInfo=false displayMessage=true displayRequiredFields=false showAnotherWayIfPresent=true>
 <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN"  "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">

replies.bodyText: @vmuzikar +1, this should work as well
replies.author: pdrozd

replies.bodyText: @pdrozd Just to be clear. You mean IE should work or the idea of dropping IE should work? :)
replies.author: vmuzikar

replies.bodyText:
@vmuzikar @pdrozd Thanks for your comments.
IE doesn't support var() function, so it's not possible to load the variables. In this case, there should be some default hardcoded values in main .css file. But, it's contradicted against what @ssilvert suggested above. Then, there will be duplicate properties in  the main .css file, in order to keep compatibility with various browsers. However, it's true, the login screen should be displayed properly on all browsers, so I'll add the default values. I just wanted to highlight this issue.
replies.author: mabartos

replies.bodyText: Just for the record, here's an official guide for IE11 support in PF4.
replies.author: vmuzikar

replies.bodyText: @vmuzikar I meant that It would be good if this page also work with IE. The support for IE is dropped, so if this is really complicated, I would not insist on this.
replies.author: pdrozd

replies.bodyText: I've created some workaround for that and it should be working with IE. But there are another screens, which should be remade then and I think, it's not worth the effort.
replies.author: mabartos

replies.bodyText:
@vmuzikar I meant that It would be good if this page also work with IE. The support for IE is dropped, so if this is really complicated, I would not insist on this.

@pdrozd @vmuzikar @mabartos Can we say for sure that IE support is dropped for login screens?  That sounds like a wider discussion.
replies.author: ssilvert

replies.bodyText: @ssilvert I think we cannot. AFAIK we only dropped IE support in Admin and new Account Consoles. If we want to drop the support for login pages as well, I think it should be blessed by PM and maybe discussed on dev ML as well.
replies.author: vmuzikar

replies.bodyText: I'd say, there could be some basic (not like with PF4) functionality/appearance in login screens and inform customer/user, that the IE support will be dropped out soon and that there is a need for using other browser. I mean, there could be some warning alert with the message. At this time, IMHO, it's not a big deal for customer/user switch to another browser. AFAIK, IE is barely supported by Microsoft, so I think, there is no need for us support that in the big manner either. WDYT?
replies.author: mabartos

replies.bodyText: @mabartos +1 but I really think that's not our call and we need to involve PM into the discussion.
replies.author: vmuzikar

replies.bodyText: @vmuzikar I agree. So, what do you suggest, when we'd like to include this in KC 12? Keep some default values, in order to provide, at least, minimal support for IE and then, after discussion, remove/keep the default values? Or is it blocker for this?
replies.author: mabartos

replies.bodyText: I see it as a blocker. We still need to count with the possibility that it needs to work in IE. And currently, some pages are broken in IE as you mentioned above, am I correct?
replies.author: vmuzikar

replies.bodyText: I vote for add any hacks needed for the IE support. And create follow-up JIRA "Remove hacks after IE support is removed" for the future :-)
replies.author: mposolda

replies.bodyText: @vmuzikar @mposolda Thanks guys! This login screen should work properly with IE, but another screens, which will be edited lately, are probably broken and we'll add the "hack" for solving that. :)
replies.author: mabartos

replies.bodyText: @mabartos Do you plan to address the IE issue in this PR or a follow-up?
replies.author: vmuzikar

replies.bodyText:
@vmuzikar @mabartos Correct me if I am wrong, but ideally it will be good to include everything in this PR? My point is, that if IE fix is done as a follow-up, then there will be some time period during which the Keycloak master will be broken with IE. Hence there is a risk of scenario like:

This PR is merged . KEycloak master will become broken with IE
Follow-up PR is send for fix IE
Keycloak 12 is released
PR from step 2 is merged. But it is late as Keycloak 12 was already released with broken IE...

(same can happen with steps 2 or 3 switched)
replies.author: mposolda

replies.bodyText: @mposolda +1
replies.author: vmuzikar

replies.bodyText:
The page is completely broken in IE. We're starting to drop IE support, but not sure if we're ready to do so on something as elementary as the login screen.

@mabartos (Cc: @vmuzikar @mposolda) after adding the workaround the screen looks good even on IE11:
replies.author: Pepo48

replies.bodyText: If this PR works correctly with IE, there won't be error with another screens. PF3 and PF4 work simultaneously, so some of the additional PRs don't have to be merged, if they have some issue with IE yet. The additional PRs only upgrade the components, which look, in most cases, very similar. This PR will work with IE, and I think, it's sufficient so far. So there won't be any follow-up task for IE workaround. Everything will be included in each PR.
replies.author: mabartos
vmuzikar

replies.bodyText: I'll try to remake it, but I can't spend a lot of time on that.
replies.author: mabartos

replies.bodyText: @mabartos Thanks!
replies.author: vmuzikar

replies.bodyText: It isn't like on Chrome or other browsers, but I think, it's sufficient. WDYT @vmuzikar ?
replies.author: mabartos
vmuzikar

replies.bodyText: @vmuzikar Thanks for your review. I know, there is some issue with register alert (some alert with longer message). But in the follow-up task with registration, there won't be this alert, but the errors will be under the inputs. Otherwise, the simple alert looks almost normal. What about edit these minor changes in follow-up task, which I'm currently working on in order to not block other PRs, which depend on this PR?
replies.author: mabartos

replies.bodyText: I think the misaligned notification icons affect all notifications, not just alerts with a longer message. It's apparent on your screenshot above too.
replies.author: vmuzikar

replies.bodyText: Yes, you're right. All notifications.
replies.author: mabartos

replies.bodyText: I was able to edit the notifications. At this moment, I think, the IE compatibility is solved for this PR. So, IMO, it could be finally merged. WDYT @vmuzikar ? :)
replies.author: mabartos

timeline.bodyText:
Found a few notification nitpicks:

The font size is much bigger than the rest of the text. They should be probably matching but the other text is maybe too small? Maybe they could meet somewhere in the middle, a compromise?
The notification box is probably missing some bottom margin.
timeline.author: vmuzikar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -113,27 +110,28 @@ <#-- App-initiated actions should not see warning messages about the need to complete the action --> <#-- during login. --> <#if displayMessage && message?has_content && (message.type != 'warning' || !isAppInitiatedAction??)> -
- <#if message.type = 'success'> - <#if message.type = 'warning'> - <#if message.type = 'error'> - <#if message.type = 'info'> - ${kcSanitize(message.summary)?no_esc} +

timeline.bodyText: The page weirdly stretches itself at ~840px width (before switching to mobile layout at ~760 px).
timeline.author: vmuzikar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,10 +1,10 @@
 <#import "template.ftl" as layout>
-<@layout.registrationLayout displayInfo=social.displayInfo displayWide=(realm.password && social.providers??); section>

replies.bodyText: I've thought, that was intended for tablet resolution. But, if I take a look at this now, we don't need this. We've dropped the side IdPs, so it's not necessary anymore.
replies.author: mabartos

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure we should do it this way. The test should be deterministic and should know whether it's fetching the error message from the notification or from the field. What if the error is displayed as field error whereas it should be a notification? And vice versa.
timeline.author: vmuzikar

timeline.bodyText: The test should be deterministic and should know whether it's fetching the error message from the notification or from the field.
timeline.author: vmuzikar

timeline.bodyText: The test should be deterministic and should know whether it's fetching the error message from the notification or from the field.
timeline.author: vmuzikar

timeline.bodyText: The test should be deterministic and should know whether it's fetching the error message from the notification or from the field.
timeline.author: vmuzikar

timeline.bodyText: Should this really be a field error? I mean a disabled account is not an input error, so why it should be assigned to a field?
timeline.author: vmuzikar

timeline.bodyText: The WebElements injected by Selenium will never be null.
